alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 2:23AM MST until March 02 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow through early afternoon will become very heavy at times later this afternoon and this evening. Snowfall rates will decrease overnight, but snow showers will continue into Thursday morning. Southwest winds from 15 to 25 mph with gusts from 35 to 45 mph, will create areas of blowing and drifting snow. Winds will decrease Wednesday evening. * WHERE...Areas above 4000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, North Rim, Sedona, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow forecast from 5 AM Today to 8 AM Thursday: Doney Park 10 to 16 inches Flagstaff 17 to 23 inches Grand Canyon 6 to 10 inches North Rim 10 to 16 inches Sedona 4 to 8 inches Valle 6 to 10 inches Williams 15 to 21 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
